text:
Hello Lucy, I'm Halima (16) the subjects I'm currently doing for a levels are as follows: Philosophy, English Literature and Geography. 

I've always been passionate about teaching since I was a kid because I love helping and educating others and often when I teach my friends they understand my teachings well. However I've also really wanted to do architecture and/or a career in graphic design but my chosen a levels won't help me get into those careers. I'm not clear in what I want to do exactly but teaching sounds great! 
Have you got any advice to offer me? or introduce yourself to me (what made you think teaching was the right career for you? Were you confused too?)
Hello! Sorry just FYI, I cannot respond during the day as I am teaching
Yes.. I started my teacher training at the age of 30.. so no, I had no idea! It is good that you have narrowed it down though
I started workong in the school office.. became a Teaching assistant.. then progressed to doing my teacher training.. and i can say it is the best decision I have ever made!

That's completely fine I'm also usually at school or busy with revision during the day:slightly_smiling_face:

What do you specifically teach?
Im a primary school teacher.. so all the subjects.. literacy maths science humanities french music!!
P.s. I did English Li at A level.. loved it!!
That's really cool! I was specifically interested in being a primary school teacher, kids are so fun!

I had a substitute teacher today for philosophy and he explained how he thought teaching at a secondary school would be much better than primary because it requires less training? I'm not completely sure but my friends mostly put me off from wanting to teach at a primary school
Are there any pros and cons of teaching at a primary school?

It depends.. you need a specialism for Secondary i think! With Primary.. they are so cute.. and when they achieve something the reaction is priceless. The proud feeling that you get as a teacher to a primary school pupil is the best feeling in the world!
To be fair.. probably the only cons of teaching (no matter what age) is the workload.. but aslong as you manage it right (which I think I am doing at the moment) then it is fine!!!
I absolutely love what I do so it is hard to find a con to be honest!

Aif you have a bit of time.. i would encourage you to go and volunteer in your local Primary School and see how you feel! You may think young ones are too young or may really like it! .. even if it is for an hour!
I wanted to volunteer/do work experience at my local primary school when I finished year 11 because I had an extra few weeks off but I had other plans unfortunately, I'll re-think that again
Yes definately! They will be so greatful too!!
Sorry if i come across enthusiastic.. i really love my job
That's totally fine! :blush: I understand why you would be enthusiastic

I also believe the most important part of your life begins at primary school and if you have a good teacher it sets you up well for your life ahead. My primary school teachers inspired and helped me a lot to become a bright student and I want to be the same role model for young children one day

That is exactly what I think!! There are different routes you can take though.. so if you wanted to do something different at University then do a graduate programme like I did means you can do other things too
